content.title: Temporary Vascular Shunts
content.definition: Temporary intraluminal conduits used to maintain blood flow during damage control surgery, before definitive vascular repair in trauma or complex vascular procedures.

key_concepts.description: Abbreviated surgical intervention prioritizing hemorrhage control and restoration of flow, deferring definitive repair until patient stabilized.
Commercially produced (Argyle, Javid, Pruitt-Inahara) or improvised (IV tubing, chest tube, feeding tube).
Trauma with coagulopathy/hypothermia, combined orthopedic-vascular injury, need to shorten operative time, complex repair requiring planning.

commercial.argyle: Straight shunt, various sizes, most commonly used
commercial.javid: Carotid shunt with T-limb for flushing

improvised.iv_tubing: Cut IV line to appropriate length

size_matching.principle: Shunt OD should match vessel ID for snug fit

preparation.debridement: Minimal debridement of injured vessel ends

insertion.proximal: Insert shunt into proximal vessel, secure with vessel loop or tie
insertion.flow_confirmation: Check for pulsatile flow, distal pulses, Doppler

methods: Silk ties around vessel over shunt
securing.key: Must prevent dislodgement but allow removal

extremity_trauma.indication: Combined vascular-orthopedic injury requiring bone fixation first
extremity_trauma.sequence: Shunt → ortho fixation → definitive vascular repair
extremity_trauma.duration: Usually <4-6 hours, can be longer if needed

abdominal_trauma.aorta: Large shunt for temporary control while resuscitating
abdominal_trauma.mesenteric: Maintain gut perfusion during damage control

monitoring.dislodgement: Kink or migration causes flow loss

management.anticoagulation: Systemic heparin if not coagulopathic, otherwise local flush only

definitive_repair.timing: After patient stabilization - hours to days depending on indication
definitive_repair.technique: Remove shunt, debride vessel ends, interposition graft or primary repair

complications.dislodgement: Can cause hemorrhage or distal ischemia

learning_objectives: List indications for temporary vascular shunts
Describe shunt selection based on vessel size
Discuss management and timing of definitive repair
clinical_pearls: Any tube can be a shunt in an emergency
Match shunt OD to vessel ID for snug fit
Check for flow immediately after insertion
Plan for definitive repair within hours - shunts are temporary
